message_1: A sample of radioactive material has an initial mass of 50 grams and a half-life of 10 days. What is the mass of the material after 20 days?
message_2:
To find the mass of the radioactive material after 20 days, we can use the formula for radioactive decay:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 50 grams, the half-life is 10 days, and the time elapsed is 20 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 50 * (1/2)^(20 / 10)

Final mass = 50 * (1/2)^2

Final mass = 50 * (1/4)

Final mass = 12.5 grams

So, after 20 days, the mass of the radioactive material will be 12.5 grams.
